Name: MVVM
Keywords: mvvm viewmodel compose hilt room retrofit kotlin
Best For: Standard modern Android apps with Compose UI
Anti Patterns: God ViewModel|Exposing mutable state|Business logic in View|Skipping repository
Notes: Default recommended architecture by Google. ViewModel survives config changes.

Name: Clean Architecture
Keywords: clean architecture usecases domain multi-module separation
Best For: Enterprise apps requiring strict separation and testability
Anti Patterns: Overengineering small apps|Unnecessary UseCases|Domain depending on data|Leaking framework types
Notes: Best for large teams needing strict boundaries. Domain layer must have zero Android deps.

Name: MVI
Keywords: mvi state intent reducer kotlin flow unidirectional side effects
Best For: Apps with complex state management and deterministic UI
Anti Patterns: State explosion|Mutable state outside reducer|Blocking main thread in reducer
Notes: Single source of truth for UI state. State is immutable updated through intents via reducer.

Name: MVP
Keywords: mvp presenter view contract legacy java
Best For: Legacy Android apps or teams migrating from Java
Anti Patterns: Massive Presenter|Tight coupling View-Presenter|Lifecycle leaks|Not detaching view
Notes: Considered legacy. Still in older codebases. Presenter holds View reference creating lifecycle issues.

Name: MVVM + Repository
Keywords: mvvm repository livedata flow viewmodel hilt room
Best For: Most modern Android apps following Google recommended arch
Anti Patterns: Repository becoming God class|Not mapping DTOs|Exposing Room entities to UI
Notes: Most commonly adopted modern Android pattern. Repository is single source of truth.

Name: Multi-Module Clean
Keywords: multi-module feature modules clean modularization gradle
Best For: Large-scale apps with multiple feature teams
Anti Patterns: Circular module deps|Shared mutable state|God core module|Tight coupling features
Notes: Enables parallel builds and independent feature development. Improves build times.

Name: Redux-like (Orbit MVI)
Keywords: orbit mvi redux unidirectional middleware side effect container
Best For: Predictable state with middleware and side effect management
Anti Patterns: Over-dispatching actions|Not using middleware for async|Navigation in reducer
Notes: Orbit provides Container hosting state and side effects. Built-in testing DSL.

Name: Compose-first
Keywords: compose state hoisting remember composable kotlin material3
Best For: New Android apps built entirely with Jetpack Compose
Anti Patterns: Business logic in composables|Not hoisting state|Overusing remember|Recomposition issues
Notes: Compose-first means entirely declarative UI. No XML layouts or Fragments needed.

Name: MVVM-C
Keywords: mvvm coordinator swiftui combine navigation ios
Best For: Modern iOS apps needing decoupled navigation
Anti Patterns: Navigation logic in ViewModel|Coordinator retaining views|Massive Coordinator
Notes: Coordinators handle navigation keeping ViewModels free of routing logic.

Name: VIPER
Keywords: viper interactor presenter entity router ios enterprise
Best For: Large enterprise iOS apps with big teams
Anti Patterns: Massive boilerplate|Unnecessary abstraction|Tight coupling|Protocol explosion
Notes: Each screen has 5 components. Very testable but extremely verbose.

Name: TCA
Keywords: tca composable pointfree reducer effect state swiftui
Best For: Composable and testable state management with SwiftUI
Anti Patterns: Overcomplicating simple features|Not scoping stores|Large monolithic reducers
Notes: Created by Point-Free. Every feature is a Reducer with State Action Effect.

Name: MVC
Keywords: mvc model view controller uikit storyboard ios
Best For: Small iOS apps or prototypes
Anti Patterns: Massive View Controller|Business logic in controller|Not separating networking
Notes: Apple original pattern. Simple but leads to Massive View Controller problem.

Name: MVVM + Router
Keywords: mvvm router swiftui navigation combine async await ios
Best For: Modern SwiftUI apps with programmatic navigation
Anti Patterns: Navigation scattered across VMs|Router God object|Not using NavigationPath
Notes: Routers handle navigation through NavigationStack. VMs focus on business logic.

Name: Clean Swift (VIP)
Keywords: vip clean swift interactor presenter worker router ios
Best For: iOS apps following Uncle Bob Clean Architecture
Anti Patterns: Excessive boilerplate|Request Response ViewModel bloat|Workers doing too much
Notes: Each scene follows unidirectional VIP cycle. Highly testable.

Name: RIBs
Keywords: ribs router interactor builder uber ios modular
Best For: Very large iOS apps with deep dependency trees
Anti Patterns: Deep RIB tree complexity|Viewless RIBs overuse|Builder God class
Notes: Created by Uber. Business logic in Interactors. Builders handle DI.

Name: BLoC
Keywords: bloc cubit event state stream flutter dart
Best For: Structured event-driven state management for Flutter
Anti Patterns: BLoC for trivial state|Not closing streams|Emitting in constructor|Nested BlocBuilders
Notes: Separates business logic from UI using Events and States. Cubit is simplified version.

Name: Provider + Clean
Keywords: provider changenotifier clean architecture flutter dart
Best For: Small to medium Flutter apps
Anti Patterns: ChangeNotifier God class|Not disposing|Calling notifyListeners too often
Notes: Provider is Flutter recommended simple state management. Scales for medium apps.

Name: Riverpod + Clean
Keywords: riverpod clean architecture code generation flutter dart freezed
Best For: Modern Flutter apps wanting compile-safe DI and state
Anti Patterns: Provider spaghetti|Not using autoDispose|Circular provider deps
Notes: Riverpod is Provider successor with compile-time safety. No BuildContext dependency.

Name: GetX
Keywords: getx controller reactive bindings flutter dart all-in-one
Best For: Small Flutter apps or rapid prototypes
Anti Patterns: Tight coupling to GetX|God controller|Not disposing|Overusing .obs
Notes: All-in-one package. Easy to learn but creates vendor lock-in. Not for large apps.

Name: Stacked (MVVM)
Keywords: stacked mvvm viewmodel service flutter dart filledstacks
Best For: Medium Flutter apps wanting structured MVVM
Anti Patterns: VM doing network calls directly|Not using services|Navigation in views
Notes: Created by FilledStacks. Structured MVVM with navigation and dialog services.

Name: Redux Toolkit
Keywords: redux toolkit slice thunk rtk query react native typescript
Best For: Large RN apps with complex global state
Anti Patterns: Everything in global state|Not using createSlice|Massive reducers|Not normalizing state
Notes: Redux Toolkit simplifies Redux. RTK Query handles data fetching and caching.

Name: Context + Hooks
Keywords: context hooks usestate usereducer react native lightweight
Best For: Small RN apps with limited shared state
Anti Patterns: Overusing context for frequent updates|Provider hell|Not memoizing context values
Notes: Built into React no extra deps. Performance degrades with frequent context updates.

Name: Zustand
Keywords: zustand store middleware persist react native typescript minimal
Best For: Medium RN apps wanting simple scalable state
Anti Patterns: Single monolithic store|Not using selectors|Mutating outside set
Notes: Minimal and unopinionated. No providers needed. Supports middleware.

Name: MobX
Keywords: mobx observable action computed reaction react native typescript
Best For: RN apps with complex domain models and reactive needs
Anti Patterns: Observable mutation outside actions|Not using computed|Circular store deps
Notes: Transparent reactive programming. Observables auto-track deps and update UI.

Name: React Query + Context
Keywords: react query tanstack context server state cache react native
Best For: RN apps primarily server-state driven
Anti Patterns: Using React Query for client state|Not setting stale times|Duplicate query keys
Notes: Separates server state (React Query) from client state (Context). Handles caching.
